abstract_summ: Person-to-person transmitted infectious diseases can cause occupational diseases (OD) These are subsumed as BK-No. 3101 in the German list of OD which applies for individuals with a considerably higher risk for infection as a consequence of their professional activity compared to the general population . Bacterial superantigens can trigger atopic dermatitis (AD) in particular cases, occupationally acquired MRSA can elicit AD .
